data.name: Word Math - Level 1
data.description:
Word Math - Level 1

<hr>

Write a function that takes a math expression string and returns the answer.

The input expression will be a sentence composed of values and operators as words or symbols.
<hr>
For this kata, level 1:
  
  * All input values will be single digit integer values (as words or numbers).
  * All inputs will have between 2 and 20 terms (i.e. "n1 + n2" to "n1 - n2 +...+ negative n20")
  * Input values can be numbers or operators, as words or symbolic.
  * Input will not have "zero" or "0"
  * No parentheses will be used.
  * All expected results will be integers.
  * All expected results will be numbers, not strings.
  * Only addition and subtraction will be used ("plus", "+", "minus", "-").
  * Negative numbers formatted as "negative 8" or "-8" or "negative eight" but never "-eight".
  * Double negatives will not be present, but subtracting a negative will. No "negative -8", "--8", or any other variation; but "minus -8", "- -8" and "- negative eight" to be expected.
  * All inputs will be standardized and valid.
  * A single space will be between all values, operators, and between "negative" and a number.
  * Test cases will be minimal (including 19 random), so efficiency is not critical.
<hr>

Example inputs and expected results:

  * "five plus seven minus four" => 8
  * "6 minus two plus -8" => -4
  * "negative 3 plus -7" => -10
  * "6 plus 5" => 11
  * "7 - negative four" => 11
  * "three plus negative 5" => -2
  * "8 + 2 - 5 + -2 - -1" => 4
  * "-3 - -2 + four" => 3
<hr>

(This is my first kata, please go easy.)
